intro: Cheirodendron trigynum var. molokaiense, commonly known as the Molokaʻi hibiscus, is a rare and endemic flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Molokaʻi. It is characterized by its large, showy yellow-orange flowers with five petals and a distinctive, fleshy calyx. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in coastal areas and dry forests. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a rough texture with a waxy coating. This species is of significant ecological importance to the native flora of Hawaii and is considered a keystone species in its habitat.
